intro: Psephellus ciscaucasicus, commonly known as the Caucasian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and narrow leaves. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
